newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Ascend, other techs up.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Ascend, other techs up.

text.p: After a bad day for many high-technology stocks during regular trading Monday, this sector rebounded somewhat after the bell, with Applied Materials Inc and Ascend Communications Inc each up 1/8, traders said.
"The techs are just trending up in general," one trader said.

Ascend had closed at 51, up 1-5/8 on the day, while Applied closed at 48, up 2-3/8. Microsoft Corp stopped sliding after the bell, trading at 90-1/8, which is where it had closed, after falling 3-7/8 during the day.
The Nasdaq composite index declined 11.43 points on the day, to 1242.64.

One tech stock that continued going down after the bell was Lam Research Corp, which late Monday afternoon said it expects to report a third-quarter loss of $1.40 per share. Analysts had been expecting a profit of $0.07.
Lam was trading after the bell at 31-1/8, after closing at 31-1/2. The stock fell 3/4 during regular trading hours.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 7,700, compared to 34,100 on Friday. Session two volume was 9,804,400, while on Friday it was 10,436,596.
